intro: Tetracera breyniana, commonly known as the Malabar tetracera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain numerous seeds. Tetracera breyniana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
